post.content:
Welcome to COSKA...

In response to your request, I would like to give you my personal
opinions.

1. A Univerisity Degree is definitely a big asset to attract
   a potential employer's attention in future.
   Please study hard .....
      
2. It is not known to me whether you have a working permit.
   However, most of time, they value work experience more than
   a Degree or a Certificate (Oracle).
   Of course, any certificate related to your skill set will
   be a nice thing to have.

3. While you are in school, please try to get some work experiences
   thru a Summer Job, Part-time or Co-op program if there is any.
   Even if you delay the graduation, it will be a big advantage
   if you have some work experience when you graduate.
   Also those opportunity might lead you to a permanent Job
   later on when you graduate.

4. I understand that the University has a 'Job Placement Center'
   where you can get advices or job informations.
   Please use it efficiently and do job search dilligently.

5. Prepare a GOOD Resume and a Cover Letter.
   Please have an expert to help you even if you have to pay.
   Remember.. The Resume and letter are the only thing between
   you and a potential employer.
   So you have to impress them with the resume and somehow you have
   make them interested in you with it.

   Also learn 'Interview skill' in case.

6. Establish some personal connections somehow with companies
   or people working out there. (Seminar, etc)
   It sometimes help a lot in job search .

7. Considering the job market now, you may NOT have many choices
   in terms of the area you want to be in . (i.e. DB, Network).
    However, it is good to have a career plan.

I hope it is some help to you..

Good Luck..

SK
